title: U.K. Parliament Workers Face Unacceptable Abuse, Report Says
description: LONDON  Lawmakers hurling heavy pieces of office equipment at aides, groping their breasts and slapping their backsides. Sexual harassment as a necessary evil for young staffers. Aides ordered to vacuum and tidy up their bosses apartments for private parties.

title: Sword of Trust Review: Marc Maron in a Comedy About Civil War Truthers
description: The writer and director Lynn Shelton specializes in low-key comedic parables featuring middle-class white Americans approaching middle age. Her characters arent quite hipsters or ex-hipsters, but they do pride themselves on being plugged in culturally (as in 2009s Hump Day, whose straight male subjects seek to affirm their progressive bona fides by making gay porn together). Theyre the kind of people whom you can envision listening to WTF, the podcast hosted by the wryly dyspeptic comedian and actor Marc Maron.

title: Sea of Shadows Review: A Suspenseful Story of Saving Porpoises
description: Its become a little easy to say that a documentary unfolds like a big-budget spectacle, but Sea of Shadows  a suspenseful, wide-screen drama filled with gunfire, cartels and corruption  is actually shot and edited like one. And thats a surprise, given that the film comes from National Geographic.

title: Summer Night Review: An Improbable Evening of Formative Experiences
description: Summer Night, the feature directorial debut of the actor Joseph Cross, is a modestly successful example of playing the hits. The film is transparently derivative, but it has enough visual panache and a feel for the rhythms of a laid-back summer evening that its tough to dislike.

title: The Sweet Requiem Review: Tibetan Activists Confront a Shared Tragic Past
description: The opening shot of The Sweet Requiem, a sometimes compelling film by the wife-and-husband directing team of Ritu Sarin and Tenzing Sonam, instantly seizes your attention. Two figures, not quite in focus and seen from behind, from their calves down to their feet, trudge through fresh white snow.

title: American Heretics Review: Challenging Religious Orthodoxies in Oklahoma
description: American Heretics: The Politics of the Gospel doesnt break ground cinematically, but it is eye-opening in other ways. This documentary from Jeanine Isabel Butler showcases progressive Christian leaders in Oklahoma whose ideas run counter to the states conservative political leanings.

title: Firecrackers Review: Young, Angry and Trapped
description: Firecrackers, Jasmin Mozaffaris astonishingly confident (and perfectly named) debut feature, opens with a flare of fury and ends on a note of anxious optimism. What happens between is often sensed more than spoken: This is a movie that, like its characters, is more fluent in feelings than in words.

title: General Magic Review: A Startup Before Its Time
description: What happens when you invent a future that remains, resolutely, in the future? Sarah Kerruish and Matt Maudes documentary General Magic looks at a Silicon Valley startup that in the early 1990s accurately imagined the world wed be living in today. The developers, designers and engineers at General Magic worked on concepts like e-commerce, touch screens, animated emoticons and, most notably, a smartphone that would contain the world.

title: With a World Cup Boost, an Agent Bets on Female Athletes
description: Trying to take advantage of the ascendance of female athletes and the popularity of the most recent Womens World Cup champions, one of the countrys leading sports agencies is forming a new division to work with companies to market to women through sports.

title: France Moves to Tax Tech Giants, Stoking Fight With White House
description: PARIS  President Emmanuel Macrons government waded into a potentially messy fight with the White House on Thursday as French lawmakers voted to impose a tax on Facebook, Google and other American technology giants despite a blunt warning from the Trump administration.

title: U.N. Rights Council to Investigate Killings in Philippine Drug War
description: GENEVA  The United Nations top human rights body voted on Thursday to examine thousands of alleged extrajudicial police killings linked to President Rodrigo Dutertes war on drugs in the Philippines, a campaign that rights groups around the world have denounced as a lawless atrocity.

title: White House Hosts Conservative Internet Activists at a Social Media Summit
description: WASHINGTON  As he opened an event that had brought 200 conservative social media firebrands to the White House, President Trump wanted his guests to know just how much he appreciated their work helping shape the online narrative about his presidency and a re-election fight.

title: Amazons Latest Experiment: Retraining Its Work Force
description: As automation technology has leapt ahead, workers increasingly worry about losing their jobs to robots and algorithms. Economists dismiss those concerns, by and large, arguing that workers can grab higher-skilled jobs with better wages.

title: Climbers Flock to Uluru Before a Ban, Straining a Sacred Site
description: SYDNEY, Australia  It is an unusual sight for the famous but remote sandstone monolith known as Uluru: dense lines of eager climbers snaking up its reddish-brown surface, headed toward the peak of a rock sacred to the Indigenous Australians who live nearby.

title: The $50 Dress That Conquered Britain
description: LONDON  The most viral fashion item of the summer thus far is not Janties (denim panties, obviously), or the bucket hat, or the big mood socks being worn at festivals across the Western Hemisphere. Rather, it appears to be a simple black and white viscose printed polka dot dress by the fast fashion giant Zara, with a price tag of 39 pounds and 99 pence, or $50.

title: Patriotism Done Right
description: This article is part of David Leonhardts newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it each weekday.

title: Trumps Efforts to Rein In Drug Prices Face Setbacks
description: President Trumps plan to lower prescription drug prices hit two major obstacles this week. He killed a proposal on Wednesday that would have reduced out-of-pocket costs for older consumers out of concern that it would raise premiums heading into his re-election campaign. And a federal judge threw out a new requirement that drug companies disclose their prices in television ads.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are five-bedroom homes in Redding, Conn., and Mamaroneck, N.Y.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are on the Upper East Side, In St. xx, Staten Island, and in Greenwood Heights, Brooklyn.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Homes for Sale in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Staten Island
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: What Can California Expect After 5 Years of Legal Marijuana?
description: Good morning.

title: Which States Build the Greenest?
description: As the Trump administration works to loosen environmental regulations, some states are moving to strengthen them. In New York, lawmakers have devised a plan to nearly eliminate carbon emissions by 2050.

title: Trump Says He Will Seek Citizenship Information From Existing Federal Records, Not the Census
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Thursday abandoned his quest to place a question about citizenship on the 2020 census, and instructed the government to compile citizenship data from existing federal records instead, ending a bitterly fought legal battle that turned the nonpartisan census into an object of political warfare.

title: Which Version of Serena Williams Is Headed to the Wimbledon Final?
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Think about No. 24? Try to block out No. 24? Play it cool? Play with fire?

title: In Veronica Mars, a Gumshoe Grows Up
description: When we last saw Veronica Mars, the greatest private investigator Southern California has ever birthed and tanned  shut it, Philip Marlowe  she had ducked a corporate law job and returned to Neptune, her beachside hometown, resolved to defend the weak, defy the powerful, wisecrack with the best of them. Happily ever after, on her terms.

title: Why Stocks Are Hitting Records as Economic Fears Rise: There Is No Alternative
description: Bad news is cheered. Good news makes investors nervous. Welcome to Wall Street.

title: Life in a City Without Water: Anxious, Exhausting and Sweaty
description: CHENNAI, India  When the waters gone, you bathe in what drips out of the air-conditioner. You no longer allow yourself the luxury of an evening shower at the end of a steamy summers day. You sprint down two flights of stairs with plastic pots as soon as a neighbor tells you the water tanker is coming.

title: After 40 Weeks of Pregnancy, Risk of Stillbirth Rises
description: When pregnancies last for 40 weeks or longer, there is an increase in the risk of stillbirth and neonatal death, a large review of studies has found. The meta-analysis also found that prolonging pregnancy beyond 40 weeks did not reduce the risk for death in the babys first month of life.

title: Politicians Dont Actually Care What Voters Want
description: We like to think that politicians care about what their constituents want. If voters in a legislative district have certain views about, say, the legality of abortion, we assume that their representatives decisions will be shaped, or at least influenced, by those views. To a large extent, democracy depends on this assumption: The beliefs of voters should be reflected, however imperfectly, in the leaders they elect.

title: Cruelty Wont Stop the Crisis at the Border
description: President Trump seems to think that holding children and families in federal government custody without beds, soap, toothbrushes or even adequate food might stem migration from Central America.  Recent reporting on these conditions in migrant detention facilities has intensified critiques of this administrations brutal approach to the families who are coming in record numbers to our southern border. In an apparent response to that scrutiny, Mr. Trump said in a tweet, If Illegal Immigrants are unhappy with the conditions in the quickly built or refitted detentions centers, just tell them not to come. All problems solved!"

title: Slave Play is Coming to Broadway
description: There are a handful of adjectives that frequently feature in Broadway marketing materials. Transgressive is not one of them.

title: Done With Stranger Things? Here Is Your Next Netflix Binge
description: This essay includes spoilers for Stranger Things and the first season of Dark.

title: Why Did This Extinct Bird Have Such a Weird, Long Toe?
description: Some 99 million years ago, a small animal with a weird elongated toe died and became partially entombed in amber. Its lower leg and foot remained undisturbed in the hardened tree resin until amber miners eventually discovered the fossil in Myanmars Hukawng Valley in 2014.

title: Rojo Review: Who Is Guilty When Dictatorship Creeps In?
description: When a country falls under a dictatorship, who is guilty  or, rather, who is not? Thats the question that beats a steady rhythm  tap, tap, tap  throughout the striking moral thriller Rojo, a vision of everyday life in mid-1970s Argentina. For a solid citizen like Claudio (Daro Grandinetti) that life looks entirely respectable, nice and quiet. He has a contented family, his own law firm and a handsome house. There, he and his wife sometimes entertain, eating cake and playing board games while pointedly avoiding any talk about state terror and disappearing compatriots.

title: Violent Thunderstorms Kill at Least 7 in Northern Greece
description: At least seven people died and more than 100 were injured after intense thunderstorms hit northern Greece, tearing out tall pine trees and destroying houses in their passing, officials said on Thursday.

title: Biden, in Foreign Policy Speech, Castigates Trump and Urges Global Diplomacy
description: After spending two weeks sparring with his presidential primary opponents, Joseph R. Biden Jr. sought once more to rise above the Democratic fray on Thursday, delivering a sweeping foreign policy address that denounced President Trump as incapable of global leadership and called for a new commitment to multilateral diplomacy.

title: Fatal Accident With Metal Straw Highlights a Risk
description: A British woman was impaled by a metal straw after falling at her home, a coroner said in an inquest this week that highlighted the potential dangers of metal straws. Such straws have surged in popularity as cities, states and even countries have banned single-use plastic straws.

title: Unemployment Is Low, but Thats Only Part of the Story
description: These should be the best of times for working people.

title: The Lion King Review: The Art of Herding Digital Cats
description: Watching the newest version of The Lion King  a big-screen celebrity-voiced musical trying its best to look like a television nature documentary  I recalled a line from John Gregory Dunnes 1969 book The Studio that may be my all-time favorite sentence in the annals of movie writing. Six months were devoted to teaching Chee Chee the Chimpanzee how to cook bacon and eggs, Dunne wrote, referring to a character in Doctor Dolittle, one of many real animals cast in that big-budget, family-friendly musical spectacle.

title: Elizabeth Warrens Immigration Plan Takes Aim at Trump-Era Abuses
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts offered an immigration proposal on Thursday that would create new protections for migrants, investigate allegations of abuse under the Trump administration and allow far higher numbers of refugees into the country.

title: Isan-Style Cooking, Just Like Moms
description: This small, cheery space is run by sisters who couldnt find a restaurant in New York that served the food they grew up with.

title: Crisp, Deep-Fried Fish at Hug Esan in Queens
description: At first glance, the fish looks like it may still be intact. The tilapias skin is a deep, woodsy brown and covered in cilantro leaves, sliced garlic, scallions and little arcs of red onion. But look closer and you see that the body has been broken down into parts, each piece dusted with flour and deep-fried, then tossed with a tamarind-fish sauce dressing and reassembled into a Cubist version of its original form.

title: Tom Steyer, We Welcome You With Folded Arms
description: I am pointedly trying not to make predictions about the presidential race. But I think I can say with confidence that Tom Steyer  a hedge fund billionaire who announced this week that he, too, was running for president  will not be the Democratic nominee.

title: To Avoid Jail Before Trial, Epstein Offers Up His Mansion and Jet for Bail
description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

title: Tropical Storm Barry: Why Rainfall Is the Biggest Threat
description: The first major storm system expected to strike the United States this hurricane season strengthened into Tropical Storm Barry on Thursday, continuing to dump rain along already inundated parts of the Gulf Coast before its expected landfall on Saturday.

title: How One Violinist Conducts an Entire Bel Canto Opera
description: It isnt unusual to see a violinist  rather than a maestro  leading a small orchestra in early music, or in works from the Baroque or Classical eras. It is extremely rare, however, to see one conducting bel canto operas, with their larger ensembles and layered rhythms, often delivered at a sprint.

title: Review: In The Farewell, a Wedding Is Really a Premature Funeral
description: The Farewell, Lulu Wangs second feature, conjures a premise so rich with potential comedy, heartbreak and family weirdness that it can only have come from real life. Which it did, via an episode of This American Life that first aired in 2016. The film version, which announces itself as based on an actual lie, has a loose, anecdotal structure and a tone that balances candor and tact. Much of the charm and power of this story  about events leading up to a  wedding thats also a fake funeral of sorts  come from the palpable sense that it genuinely happened to someone.

title: House Democrats Approve Subpoenas for Whos Who of Mueller Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON  The House Judiciary Committee on Thursday approved a dozen new subpoenas targeting a whos who of witnesses cited in Robert S. Mueller IIIs report as Democrats sought to elevate their showdown with President Trump over episodes of possible obstruction of justice documented by the special counsel.

title: Heres One List Where Kirsten Gillibrand Is Winning and Kamala Harris Is Tied With Marianne Williamson
description: Amid the relentless focus on Washington and presidential politics, a liberal political action committee has ranked the 2020 Democratic presidential candidates on something much lower on the political food chain  what they are doing to help Democrats win state legislative seats.

title: You Call It Starvation. I Call It Biohacking.
description: The run happened  or didnt  maybe five days into the raw-diet experiment.

title: The Country-Rap Song Taking Over Nashville? It Isnt Old Town Road
description: The second most-viewed version of Blanco Browns The Git Up on YouTube  after the original, audio-only clip  is a video in which he teaches the country singer Lainey Wilson the songs accompanying dance.

title: How to Create a Chinese Feast, Inspired by Lulu Wangs The Farewell
description: Dad! You have to say he did a good job, said the filmmaker Lulu Wang. She was addressing her father, Haiyan Wang, who was sitting next to me at dinner. It was a beautiful recent evening at the West Hollywood restaurant Auburn. A bottle of Maotai, the fiery Chinese liquor, was open, a feast of Chinese food was in front of us. Lulu has made a film about her family called The Farewell, which comes out this week, and I was curious whether her father liked how he was portrayed by the actor Tzi Ma. Lulus boyfriend, the Oscar-winning director Barry Jenkins, ever the peacemaker, chimed in: Knowing him and knowing you, he did a good job. Hes not imitating you, hes himself as you. Her father nodded with a knowing smile.

title: Promenade Review: A 60s Musical That Offers Zany Delights
description: Grasping for a plot will not help you, because there isnt much of one. And for all their fabulous looks, the characters dont exactly have three dimensions. Promenade, the bizarre and sneakily thrilling 1960s musical with a book and lyrics by the then-fledgling playwright Mara Irene Forns, is by no means a conventional piece of theater.

title: Cities of Last Things Review: A History of One Mans Violence
description: Just because a movie puts an overwrought ending at the beginning doesnt make that ending less  well, wrought. Cities of Last Things, picked up by Netflix after winning the top prize in the Toronto International Film Festivals juried section, opens with an upward-looking shot of an apartment building. The jaunty soundtrack is undermined when a man flies off the roof, straight toward the camera. [Squelching], the subtitles say as his blood spreads out.

title: Mom, Can You Please Cover Up?
description: I am a teenage boy, and I have a dispute with my mom. She has tattoos all over her arms and back, and theyre not particularly nice ones. Id call them R-rated. My friends think shes weird, and theyve made remarks to me about the tattoos. Ive asked her to cover them up when my friends are around. But she says that if people dont like her tattoos, thats their problem. (She means me.) Was I out of line for asking her to be discreet about the tattoos to save me some embarrassment?

title: His Acts Are Despicable: Key Moments in the Case Against Jeffrey Epstein
description: The sex-trafficking charges filed against Jeffrey Epstein this week in Manhattan underscored the long scope of the investigation into accusations that he engaged in sexual acts with girls, some as young as 14, in both his Upper East Side townhouse and his residence in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Afghan War Casualty Report: July 5-11
description: At least 143 pro-government forces and 52 civilians were killed in Afghanistan during another bloody week of fighting amid ongoing peace talks in Doha. The deadliest attack took place in Kunduz Province, where the Taliban attacked two military bases and several security outposts in Imam Sahib District, capturing one base and three security outposts in seven hours of fighting. At least 20 members of the security forces were killed, 15 were wounded and another 10 were taken prisoner. On Sunday, a Taliban car bomb killed 12 people in Ghazni City. Nearly 200 people were also wounded in the explosion, including more than 100 children.

title: Review: Mark Morris Playfully Tackles Sport at Mostly Mozart
description: Each of the 21 piano pieces that make up Erik Saties Sports et Divertissements has a title defining its subject: fishing, racing, tennis, golf. The program for Sport, Mark Morriss new dance to the Satie score, doesnt reproduce those titles. For this dance, such labels would be redundant.

title: Hold Em or Fold Em? This A.I. Bluffs With the Best
description: In his 14 years on the professional poker circuit, Darren Elias had never faced anyone who played with so little fear.

title: Where to Stream the 90s Black Film Boom
description: Thirty years ago this month, Spike Lees hit 1989 film, Do the Right Thing, helped bring attention to a then emerging generation of black directors in Hollywood. Recently, The New York Times convened a discussion of six filmmakers  Julie Dash, Ernest Dickerson, Leslie Harris, Darnell Martin, Matty Rich and Theodore Witcher  who were at the center of a black film boom that followed, and who lived with the consequences after it went bust.

title: Climate Change Fills Storms With More Rain, Analysis Shows
description: When a tropical storm is approaching, its intensity or wind speed often gets the bulk of the attention. But as Tropical Storm Barry bore down on the Gulf Coast , it was the water that the storm would bring with it that had weather watchers worried.

title: The Case for Transporting Rescue Dogs
description: To the Editor:

title: Forgot to Sign Up for Minor League Hockey Alerts? You Missed Some Drama
description: When minor league hockey fans began receiving a flurry of push notifications from the American Hockey League app on Wednesday, they may have been expecting off-season news about the Cleveland Monsters, Lehigh Valley Phantoms or Rockford IceHogs. Instead, for roughly 20 minutes, users were bombarded with bizarre alerts that demanded a $6,000 payment from a man named Stewart Zimmel.

title: Nancy Pelosi and the Young Progressives
description: To the Editor:

title: Taiwan President Risks Infuriating China With U.S. Visit
description: The leader of Taiwan, the self-governing island of 24 million claimed by China, visited the United States on Thursday and said her people would never be intimidated, risking Chinas wrath and a further fraying of ties between Beijing and the Trump administration.

title: Francine Shapiro, Developer of Eye-Movement Therapy, Dies at 71
description: One spring afternoon in 1987, a psychology student trying to shake off an upsetting memory took a stroll through a park in Los Gatos, Calif., distracting herself by darting her eyes back and forth. The sting of the memory quickly faded, and the student, Francine Shapiro, glimpsed her future.

title: Is This the End of Anonymous Shell Companies? Not Too Fast
description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

title: What Leonardo da Vinci Couldnt Finish
description: The 500th anniversary of the death of Leonardo da Vinci will bring big doings to Paris this fall with the largest-ever and one-stop-only career survey at the Louvre. And New York gets a shot of buzz in advance with the opening at the Met on July 15 of a single-painting show of one of the most rawly emotional images in the Leonardo canon.

title: Madame Mela, Tu Astrloga Favorita
description: El Espace is a column dedicated to news and culture relevant to Latinx communities. Expect politics, arts, analysis, personal essays and more. Lo mejor? Itll be in Spanish and English, so you can forward it to your ta, your primo Lalo or anyone else (read: everyone).

title: California Lawmakers Give Utilities a Backstop on Wildfire Liability
description: Heading into another wildfire season, Californias political leaders have moved with unusual speed to help the states utilities erect a backstop against huge liability claims.

title: Andrew Dibner, Medical Alert Pioneer, Is Dead at 93
description: Andrew Dibner, a psychologist who created a new segment in the health care industry when he invented a medical alert system that let elderly and disabled people call for help when they cannot reach a telephone or knock on a neighbors door, died on Saturday in a memory care facility in Peoria, Ariz. He was 93.

title: Review: The Little Prince Travels the Universe but Never Lifts Off
description: PHILADELPHIA  Princes have a way of showing up in dances  even the innocent young interstellar traveler from Antoine de Saint-Exuprys The Little Prince. Now, BalletX has added its own rendition of that beloved novella, and its all about letting the inner child out.

title: Its Easy to Hate Selfies. But Can They Also Be a Force for Good?
description: This month, when earthquakes rocked Southern California on back-to-back days, it was a visceral reminder that we may one day experience the Big One, a quake with the power to kill and destroy.

title: F.E.C. Allows Security Company to Help 2020 Candidates Defend Campaigns
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Federal Election Commission said on Thursday that a Silicon Valley security company could immediately start helping 2020 presidential candidates defend their campaigns from the kinds of malicious email attacks that Russian hackers exploited in the 2016 election.

title: Archaeologists Find Rare Viking-Age Boat Burials in Sweden
description: Archaeologists have found two rare boat burials from the Viking age in Sweden, offering what they say is a glimpse into how customs and practices changed in the tumultuous era of raids, religious conversion and trade.

title: Julie Sweet to Run Accenture, Adding a Woman to the Ranks of Corporate C.E.O.s
description: Julie Sweet will become the new chief executive of Accenture, the consulting firm announced on Thursday, adding another female leader to the senior-most ranks of the corporate world.

title: I Often Worry That My Time in the Industry Is Limited: Black Artists Reflect on Diversity in Their Fields
description: Soon after I started looking into why the black film boom of the early 1990s  an era that gave us the first African-American directors to become household names, Spike Lee and John Singleton  went bust, I saw clear parallels with Hollywood today.

title: Iran, South Korea, Chennai: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Trumps Asia Gamble: Shatter Enduring Strategies on China and North Korea
description: WASHINGTON  As he tries to tackle the greatest challenges to American power in Asia, President Trump is overturning policy toward China and North Korea that for decades was as canonical as Confucian ritual.

title: Like Im Some Kind of Criminal: Tougher Fines in Tennis
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Anna Tatishvilis tennis comeback looked merciless even before she took the court last month. After losing 19 months of her career to a persistent ankle injury, she returned at the French Open and learned that she had drawn an opponent nobody wanted to face in the first round: the No. 29 seed, Maria Sakkari, who led the womens tour with 12 clay-court wins heading into the tournament.

title: Jim Bouton Opened Up the Major Leagues to Everyone
description: In high school they called him Warm-Up, because he only ever pitched in the bullpen. He was an unknown, this Jim Bouton, having just moved to Illinois from New Jersey. He loved the game, sure. But that didnt mean they had to let him pitch.

title: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: A couple of years ago, the song of the summer for me was Jason Isbells sweet-sad If We Were Vampires, with its perfect blend of romance and mortality: Its knowing that this cant go on forever / Likely one of us will have to spend some days alone. (That line becomes next-level excellent when you realize that the haunting backup vocals are provided by Isbells wife, Amanda Shires.) This summer, Im getting a similarly poignant shiver from the novella Walt Kaplan Is Broke, which closes Peter Orners terrific new story collection Maggie Brown & Others and features a coronary patient taking stock of his long, mostly happy marriage: Im afraid of dying because I love my wife. Theres a lot of affection in that story, and in all of Orners characteristically generous work, and you could do worse than settling in with his book this week.

title: 5 Lobster Tails and a $560 Bottle of Wine, at Taxpayers Expense, Give Macron a Headache
description: PARIS  A photo of five giant lobster tails, neatly encased in their shells and arrayed on a table sparkling with crystal and fine white wine, has exploded across the internet and endangered the career of a stalwart in the cabinet of President Emmanuel Macron of France.

title: What Does the Author of Where the Crawdads Sing Think You Should Read?
description: Delia Owens returns to Beloved every now and then: One sentence from Toni Morrison can inspire a lifetime of writing.

title: An Alligator Captivates Chicago from Deep Inside a West Side Lagoon
description: Updated July 16, 2019: A week after an alligator was first spotted in a Chicago park lagoon, officials reported that the animal had been captured. What did it take? Officials closed much of the park for a day, and brought in an alligator expert from Florida. The animal was expected to be checked out and eventually moved to an animal sanctuary or zoo.

title: 7 Dance Performances to See in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to dance performances happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 7 Things to Do With Your Kids in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for children and teenagers happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 3 Film Series to Catch in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to film series and special screenings happening this weekend and in the week ahead. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: 27 Art Exhibitions to View in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to new art shows and some that will be closing soon.

title: 6 Classical Music Concerts to See in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 10 Plays and Musicals to Go to in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: 5 Comedy Shows to Catch in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 15 Pop, Rock and Jazz Concerts to Check Out in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: David Koloane, Whose Art Was a Weapon Against Apartheid, Dies at 81
description: David Koloane, a pivotal figure in the art of apartheid-era South Africa  as a painter, teacher, activist and organizer of community-based black and interracial art centers  died on June 30 at his home in Johannesburg. He was 81.

title: General Calls Rushed Troop Withdrawal From Afghanistan a Strategic Mistake
description: WASHINGTON  Withdrawing American troops from Afghanistan too soon would be a strategic mistake, President Trumps nominee for Joint Chiefs of Staff chairman said Thursday, clearly outlining the Pentagons position as the White House wrestles with whether to pull military forces and end the 18-year war.

title: Prime Days Best Sellers by Year
description: Each July for the past four summers, Amazon has held a (made-up) retail holiday called Prime Day, offering some of the deepest discounts of the year on all kinds of things.

title: House Moves Again to Cut Off Support to Saudi War in Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted on Thursday to cut off American support for Saudi Arabias war in Yemen and to prevent the Trump administration from using its emergency authority to transfer munitions to the kingdom, delivering twin rebukes as Democrats sought to leave their stamp on military policy.

title: A David Bowie Barbie: Mattel Unveils Ziggy Stardust Doll
description: On Thursday, the world learned that Barbie is a Bowie fan.

title: Three Governors on How Theyre Fighting Trumps Census Manipulation
description: Its been a tumultuous few days tracking whether and how a citizenship question will be included in the 2020 census. And it appears President Trump has finally conceded defeat after the Supreme Court blocked the question from being included last month.

title: Census, Tropical Storm Barry, The Lion King: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: World Trade Center Arts Project Finds New President
description: The final piece of the plan to revitalize the World Trade Center site  the creation of a performing arts center now named for the businessman Ronald O. Perelman  took another step forward on Thursday with the selection of a new president, Leslie Koch.

title: Marlon Brandos Rolex From Apocalypse Now Resurfaces
description: Every art form has its lost masterpieces. Watches are no different.

title: Colin Palmer, Historian of the African Diaspora, Is Dead at 75
description: Colin A. Palmer, a historian who broadened the understanding of the African diaspora, showing that the American slave trade was only one part of a phenomenon that spanned centuries and influenced cultures worldwide, died on June 20 in Kingston, Jamaica. He was 75.

title: How to Make Alexander Acosta a Political Martyr
description: Democratic lawmakers have a few questions for Alexander Acosta. President Trumps labor secretary has been summoned to appear before the House Oversight and Reform Committee to explain his role in the 2008 plea deal given to Jeffrey Epstein, the wealthy financier accused of sexually abusing and trafficking scores of teenage girls.

title: The Plight of Republican Women
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: Koch Executives Harassment in China Adds to Fears Among Visitors
description: A Koch Industries executive was told he could not leave China. An ex-diplomat who helped organize a technology forum in Beijing was hassled by authorities who wanted to question him. An industry group developed contingency plans, in case its offices were raided and computer servers were seized.

title: Walt Michaels, Outspoken Coach of the Jets, Is Dead at 89
description: Walt Michaels, a strong-willed and occasionally undiplomatic coach who led the Jets to the 1982 American Football Conference championship game but was ousted after they lost, died on Wednesday at a nursing home in Plains, Pa. He was 89.

title: The New Plot Against Obamacare
description: The Affordable Care Act was an imperfect and incomplete reform. The political compromises needed to get it through Congress created a complex system in which too many people fall through the holes. It was also underfunded, which is why deductibles are often uncomfortably high. And the law has faced sabotage both from G.O.P.-controlled state governments and, since 2017, the Trump administration.

title: Texas Latina Emerges as Houses Voice of Passion and Reason on the Border
description: CIUDAD JUREZ, Mexico  In the blazing Mexican heat last week, Representative Veronica Escobar consoled a young woman named Fatima, who described in a flood of Spanish how she had been raped in her native Nicaragua, separated by American authorities from her 5-year-old daughter in May, and sent back to Mexico to wait alone on her asylum claim. Her only wish now, Fatima said, was to be with her daughter again.

title: A Super Bowl Trip, a Bribery Indictment and the Taxi Industrys Corruption
description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

title: Uncle Trump Wants You! (To Join His Troll Army)
description: On Thursday afternoon, just as the titans of the pro-Trump internet gathered at the White House to commiserate about Big Techs tyrannous reign of censorship over conservative speech, the entire world was briefly deplatformed by a global Twitter blackout.

title: Jeffrey Epstein Registered as a Sex Offender in 2 States. In New Mexico, He Didnt Have To.
description: STANLEY, N.M.  Jeffrey Epstein, the New York financier, managed to evade federal prosecution a decade ago in a Florida sex case involving dozens of teenage girls, in part by agreeing to register as a sex offender. But for a man with many residences, and many high-powered lawyers, registering as a sex offender was not the blanket penalty it might seem.

title: U.A.E. Pulls Most Forces From Yemen in Blow to Saudi War Effort
description: For four years, the United Arab Emirates have been the military linchpin of the Saudi-led war in Yemen, providing weapons, money and thousands of ground troops to a campaign to drive out Yemens Houthi rebels. Emirati forces led almost every major advance the coalition made.

title: Trump Uses Twitter to Govern. I Used It to Cover His Social Media Summit.
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump invited some of his most ardent digital warriors to the White House on Thursday for its first social media summit. Twitter was not there and its platform was down in the hours leading up to the event  the company blamed an internal configuration change.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have?
description: Harlots When to watch: Now, on Hulu.

title: Stop Surveillance Humanitarianism
description: A standoff between the United Nations World Food Program and Houthi rebels in control of the capital region is threatening the lives of hundreds of thousands of civilians in Yemen.

title: Corrections: July 12, 2019
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day: Pastors Exit Exposes Cultural Rifts at a Leading Liberal Church
description: We strive to be a heavenly banquet where all are welcome. But often that banquet erupts into a food fight.

title: Democrats Demand Briefing and Documents on Epstein Plea Deal
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats waded further on Thursday into a dispute over Labor Secretary R. Alexander Acostas handling of a sex crimes prosecution of the financier Jeffrey Epstein when he was a federal prosecutor more than a decade ago, demanding a briefing from Justice Department officials and access to documents related to the plea agreement he oversaw.

title: Map: Tracking Tropical Storm Barrys Path
description: Expected rainfall and path for a storm that threatens Louisiana.

title: Russias Police Tolerate Domestic Violence. Where Can Its Victims Turn?
description: MOSCOW  He beat her. He kidnapped her. He threatened to kill her.

title: Russell Westbrook Traded to Rockets as a Wild N.B.A. Off-Season Continues
description: The Oklahoma City Thunder have traded away the last pillar of their 2012 N.B.A. finals team by agreeing to a deal Thursday night that will reunite Russell Westbrook and James Harden as Houston Rockets teammates.

title: Forty-Niners Equipment
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  If life was logical, the difficulty levels of crossword puzzles would get easier as the week goes on. We would start out the week with a real brain twister  sort of a multivitamin for the brain  to rev up our engines and get us primed for the week ahead. Then, after a long, busy week, we would put our feet up and solve a smooth, straightforward crossword to boost our self-confidence and let us know that, despite what might be going on in other parts of our messy lives, we succeeded in putting at least one thing in order.

title: Indigenous Australians Want a Voice to Parliament. What Does That Entail?
description: The Australia Letter is a weekly newsletter from our Australia bureau. Sign up to get it by email. This weeks issue is written by Isabella Kwai, a reporter with the Australia bureau.

title: Review: The Greeks Go Coachella in a Boisterous Bacchae
description: If youre in the mood for a music-infused retelling of a Greek myth, but cant find, or afford, tickets to the Tony Award-winning Hadestown on Broadway, set your aim about 80 blocks north of midtown. There, in Marcus Garvey Park, the Classical Theater of Harlem is presenting a completely free and totally exhilarating new adaptation of The Bacchae that will leave you wanting to join the chorus.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: When a Dating Dare Leads to Months of Soul Searching
description: At 2 a.m., two blocks from Chinatown, Sarah ended our first date by telling me that my race might be an issue.

title: At Latino Forum, Democratic Candidates Channel Anxiety Over Immigration
description: MILWAUKEE  Senator Elizabeth Warren accused President Trump of stirring hate. Julin Castro said the president had acted like a dictator. The Trump administrations actions, warned Beto ORourke, threaten to stain the nations conscience.

title: On Politics: Trump Abandons Census Fight
description: Good Friday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

title: U.S. Prosecutors File New Charges, Including Child Pornography, Against R. Kelly
description: [Read our latest story on R.Kelly being accused of using bribes to marry singer Aaliyah at age 15.]

title: After Dozens of Fentanyl Killings, Hospital C.E.O. and 23 Employees Are Forced Out
description: The chief executive of an Ohio health care system announced his resignation and the termination of 23 employees on Thursday, one month after a doctor who worked for the hospital was charged in one of the largest murder cases in the states history.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Shangri-La and Two Denzel Washington Movies
description: SHANGRI-LA 9 p.m. on Showtime. The fabled Shangri-La recording studio in Malibu, Calif., was once a hangout for the Band and Bob Dylan. Now, its an oasis overseen by the megaproducer Rick Rubin  and a reflection of Rubins minimalist sensibilities. So it makes sense as a setting for this four-part documentary from the director Morgan Neville (Wont You Be My Neighbor?), which takes a meandering dive into Rubins life and work as a producer. The fact that Rubin has worked across so many genres (his best-known collaborations include producing for acts like the Beastie Boys and Johnny Cash) means that this dive should have something for everyone. But as the title suggests, the star may be the studio itself. Theres an extra, added feeling of coming to a place where a lot of good music has been made, Rubin says in the first episode. I dont know if its the energy collected in the space, or if its just peoples belief, he adds. It doesnt really matter.

title: Another Wimbledon Showdown for Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal
description: On Friday, in the Wimbledon semifinals, Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal will play for the 40th time in their careers. No. 39 was only a month ago, in a French Open semifinal that Nadal won in straight sets to bring his record against Federer to 24-15.

title: Young Afghan General Tries to Overhaul Police With American Way of War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  His police chief in Nangarhar Province needed more heavy weapons. His police chief in Paktia Province needed more radios. And Brig. Gen. Khoshal Sadat needed the two men to stop reading directly from their PowerPoint slides as they rattled off the security situation in their districts during their video conference.

title: For the Second Half, the Yankees Have a Short Wish List: Pitching
description: Even when the Yankees were in London to play the Boston Red Sox at the end of the June, General Manager Brian Cashman could not focus entirely on the moment. He was having trouble sleeping one night with the five-hour time difference, so at 1:30 a.m. London time, he fired off text messages to rival general managers back in the United States who were surprised to hear from him while he was in Europe.

title: Central Parks Castle Gets a $12 Million Fairy-Tale Makeover
description: The French have Versailles. The British, Buckingham Palace. And Spaniards, the Alhambra.

title: As Nations Look to Tax Tech Firms, U.S. Scrambles to Broker a Deal
description: WASHINGTON  For most of the 21st century, wealthy nations have engaged in a race to the bottom on corporate taxes, cutting rates in an effort to poach business activity across borders. Very quickly, that script has flipped.

title: The Mets at Midseason: Can They Dig Their Way Out?
description: Mickey Callaway spent his All-Star break relaxing with his two daughters in the Florida Keys. The Mets and their fans are hoping that their second-year manager  in between fishing, swimming with dolphins and lying on the beach  was able to put together a plan to jump-start the team for the second half of the season.

title: Indonesia Frees Canadian Accused of Using Magical Powers to Abuse Children
description: BANGKOK  A Canadian educator who has said he was wrongfully sentenced to 11 years in prison on charges of sexually abusing children at a Jakarta school has been granted clemency and returned to Canada, his family said on Friday.

title: Who Mows the Lawn at Storm King, New Yorks Largest Sculpture Park?
description: Storm King Art Center isnt a museum, exactly. Instead of hanging on white walls or resting on pedestals under track lighting, the art here is nestled amid 500 acres of verdant hills, exposed to the ever-shifting and unrelenting climate of New Yorks Hudson Valley.

title: Turkey Gets Shipment of Russian Missile System, Defying U.S.
description: ISTANBUL  Defying strenuous American objections and the threat of sanctions, Turkey began receiving the first shipment of a sophisticated Russian surface-to-air missile system on Friday, a step certain to test the countrys uneasy place in the NATO alliance.

title: Duduzane Zuma, Son of South Africas Ex-President, Is Acquitted in Homicide Case
description: JOHANNESBURG  A politically influential son of former President Jacob Zuma of South Africa was cleared of culpable homicide on Friday in a case that has come to be seen as a proxy for factional battles within the governing African National Congress.

title: What Counts as a Democracy? And Other Questions.

title: Where Are All the Bob Ross Paintings? We Found Them.
description: Bob Ross painted more than 1,000 landscapes for his television show  so why are they so hard to find? Solving one of the internets favorite little mysteries.

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Millennial Love, a Mysterious Illness and Diets for Heart Health
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: When Our Daughter Walked In on Us
description: One sunny Sunday morning, my husband and I were in bed, right in the middle of things, when he shouted and pulled the comforter over us. But it was too late: Wed been caught.

title: Beware the Writer as Houseguest
description: Consider the writer as houseguest. Is it a good idea to invite someone into your home whose occupation it is to observe everything? The writer as host might be no better. Even the most thoughtful guest will undoubtedly interfere with the writers productivity during the visit. Its really no surprise that people who write for a living have given us some of our wisest sayings about a visits proper length.

title: The Dress Code at Goop May Not Surprise You
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Im buying that shirt, the publicist said to her boss. It was an everyday office compliment, except the boss in question was Gwyneth Paltrow (G.P., as shes known at the office), the founder and lifestyle guru behind Goop, which sells crystals, cashmere and much more.

title: Move Over, Therapy Dogs. Hello, Therapy Cows.
description: NAPLES, N.Y.  Even without a psychology degree, Bellas natural talents made her an excellent therapist: She is calm and accommodating of a range of personalities, with the patience to listen to endless problems without so much as a judgmental moo.

title: A Novel About Womens Solidarity That Nods at Magic Marker Terrorists
description: WOMEN ON A MISSION

title: The Long History of the U.S. Government Asking Americans Whether They Are Citizens
description: When Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross ordered the Census Bureau to attach a question on citizenship to the 2020 census, the first argument he used to back up his decision was also the simplest: Weve always asked. The question has been a longstanding historical practice, he wrote, asked in some form or another for nearly 200 years.

title: Tropical Storm Barry Nears Louisiana City That Eluded Recent Hurricanes
description: Morgan Citys motto is Right in the Middle of Everywhere. On Saturday morning, the Louisiana city of 12,000 people may find itself right in the middle of a hurricane.

description: WIMBLEDON, England  Unlike Roger Federer and Rafael Nadals duel into the twilight on Centre Court in 2008, their match Friday was not a contender for the greatest match of all time.

title: New in Paperback: Lake Success, Bring the War Home
description: Lake Success, by Gary Shteyngart. (Random House, $18.) Overwhelmed by his young sons autism diagnosis and dodging a subpoena from the S.E.C., this books antihero leaves behind a job at a Manhattan hedge fund and hops on a Greyhound bus, hoping to reconnect with an ex-girlfriend teaching Holocaust studies in El Paso. Shteyngarts frantic humor keeps the story afloat and gleefully satirizes the upper class.

title: New York Was Supposedly Getting Better for Cyclists. What Happened?
description: On a particularly humid evening this week, hundreds of cyclists gathered in Washington Square Park for an action reminiscent of the years when AIDS summoned so many to protest bureaucratic indifference to tragedy. After several speeches addressing the need for cyclists to be better protected on the road, those who came to the park staged a die-in, lying down in mournful silence  a response to what has become known in the biking community as the crisis.

title: American Commandos Gear Up for New Shadow War With Russia
description: SZOLNOK, Hungary  Secretive, behind-the-lines mission rehearsals and other operations by 1,400 American and allied commandos to combat shifting Russian threats have laid bare a fundamental tension in the Trump administration: While the president courts Moscow, much of his government considers it an increasingly dangerous foe.

title: A Balkans Cycling Trip: Great Scenery! Ice-Cold Beer! And Bats and Land Mines?
description: My four friends and I rolled our bikes to a bar one sunny afternoon near the town of Zitomislici on the banks of the emerald green Neretva River in rural Bosnia. We stopped at Neretvansky Gusar, as the bar is called, to restock our water supply. There was only one problem: I only have ice-cold beer, apologized the longhaired proprietor, Nikola Bevanda, who prefers the nickname Svabo, slang for The German.

title: The 2008 Crash Made This Madrid Suburb a Ghost Town. Now Its Coming Alive.
description: In Valdeluz, a town outside Madrid that was envisioned as a commuters paradise when it was created 15 years ago, there was always supposed to be a school. And a private one, for kindergartners to high schoolers, opened in September 2007  just a year before the global financial crisis burst Spains property bubble.

title: Turning New York Green
description: The ambitious plan to fight climate change in New York will have an outsize effect on housing here.

title: Counting Down to a Green New York
description: New Yorks ambitious plan to fight climate change by virtually eliminating greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 is underway  and the battle begins at home.

title: Facebooks Digital Money Could Mean Fabulous Wealth. Or Not.
description: Jack Ma, a co-founder of Alibaba,  was recently asked about the secret of his success. I know nothing about technology, he said. I know nothing about marketing. He said what he knows about is people. A successful business, he said, is all about making people happy.

title: Where Are All the Bob Ross Paintings? We Found Them.
description: Bob Ross made three versions of each painting that appeared on The Joy of Painting. The first was made before the show, to be used as a reference. He painted the second during the 26-minute taping, sometimes with last-minute improvisations. The third was made afterward, for instructional books.

description: Tracy Nuetzi, a Trump voter and resident of Florida, was an American citizen for 60 years, until the country decided she wasnt.

title: Snapchat Message Leads to Longer Story for Hunter McGrady
description: Hunter McGrady has not always benefited from her own no-judgment approach to people of all shapes and sizes. Before she became a plus-size model in her early 20s, she succumbed to industry pressure to be thin, at times starving herself to a level that scared her.

title: Trumps Cruelty and Mexicos Duty
description: MEXICO CITY  Here in Mexico, as around the world, we are haunted by the wrenching image of scar Alberto Martnez Ramrez, 25, and his 23-month-old daughter, Valeria, nestled together on the bank of the Rio Grande after they drowned in the river near the international bridge to Texas. This tragedy shines an unforgiving light on the President Trumps crackdown on legal asylum claims at the border.

title: Ai Weiwei: Can Hong Kongs Resistance Win?
description: June 29. A 21-year-old woman writes something on the wall of a public housing stairwell in Fanling, a working-class suburb of Hong Kong:

title: It Was Never About Busing
description: When Senator Kamala Harris confronted former Vice President Joe Biden at the second Democratic presidential debate about his support of bills to ban busing for school desegregation during the 1970s and early 80s, he gave a sort of denial. I did not oppose busing in America, he said. What I opposed is busing ordered by the Department of Education. Thats what I opposed.

title: Long-Short Funds: Long on Complexity, Short on Returns

title: Day Care and Dog Care Helped Plump These Funds Returns
description: Tweets and talk may have recently raged about trade wars and rising interest rates, but that pessimism didnt hamper three of the second quarters better-performing mutual funds. They found winning investments with bets as varied as child care, pet health and banking.

title: Ford and VW Agree to Share Costs of Self-Driving and Electric Cars
description: Ford Motor and Volkswagen said Friday that they would team up to develop self-driving cars and share electric-car components. The move broadens an existing alliance and shows how automakers are putting aside rivalries to manage the cost of new technologies.

title: In the Search for Safe Assets, Investors Detour Around Gold
description: Everywhere, it seems, the world has been steeped in turbulence and strife, and that might seem to be the perfect setting for a major rally in gold, long considered an investment haven.

description: Video gaming has gone from an activity conducted in arcades, dens and rec rooms to a mobile phenomenon where players meet, live and play in virtual space.
