description: [Read all Times reporting on the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing. | Sign up for the weekly Science Times email.]

title: Mumbai Building Collapse Kills at Least 14, With More Trapped
description: NEW DELHI  A residential building in Mumbai, Indias busy financial center, collapsed on Tuesday, killing at least 14 people and trapping others, officials said Wednesday.

title: How Can You Put Life of Pi Onstage? With Puppets
description: SHEFFIELD, England  In 2001, Yann Martels internationally best-selling novel Life of Pi asked the question: What would happen if a teenage boy and a 450-pound tiger were stranded on a lifeboat for 227 days? Now, a new theatrical production is trying to answer another question: How on earth would you put such a story onstage?

title: Police in Crete Say Suspect Admitted Killing American Scientist
description: A man has confessed to raping and killing an American scientist whose body was found last week in a cave on the island of Crete, the authorities said on Tuesday.

title: Alonzo King and Jason Moran Create a Dialogue of Movement and Music
description: When the Vail International Dance Festival proposed to Alonzo King that he choreograph a new work featuring four members of his San Francisco company, Lines Ballet, and four from New York City Ballet, he knew just what he needed: a partner.

title: Game of Thrones and HBO Dominate 2019 Emmy Nominations
description: Game of Thrones demolished an Emmys record on Tuesday, picking up 32 nominations, the highest total for any show in a single year. The final season of the HBO series beat out NYPD Blue, which had 26 nominations in 1994.

title: For Modern Strikeouts, Pitchers Veer Outside the Strike Zone
description: Earlier in his career, whenever he fell behind in the count against some of baseballs best hitters, the Houston Astros ace Justin Verlander would do some on-the-mound calculus. He would often opt to fire a down-and-away fastball, willing to concede a single rather than something worse  Here you go, take your hit to the opposite field.

title: Conjoined Twins, Linked at Skull, Are Separated in London Hospital
description: LONDON  When Zainab Bibi gave birth to her eighth and ninth children  twin girls  it was five days before she was well enough to be introduced to them. All she knew was that they had both survived the cesarean section and were healthy.

title: Walls on Wheels and Movable Pods: The Evolution of the Open Workplace
description: In recent years, new office designs have encouraged employees to get moving. Cafes and lounges beckon workers when they need a break. Open staircases spur them to climb floors rather than take the elevator. Sit-stand desks offer them a chance to stretch while continuing to work.

title: Eric Garners Death Will Not Lead to Federal Charges for N.Y.P.D. Officer
description: [For more about police violence and unrest, go here]

title: California Today: Why L.A. Police Have Been Investigating Nipsey Hussle
description: Good morning.

title: Pete Buttigieg and Kamala Harris Have Made Waves. Some Progressives Remain Skeptical.
description: WATERLOO, Iowa  Mayor Pete Buttigieg raised more money in the most recent quarter than anyone else in the 2020 field and has generated excitement among Democratic donors unseen for a new national political figure since Barack Obamas first presidential campaign.

title: What Is Your Favorite Summer Travel Destination?
description: Our @nytimestravel Instagram account recently gained its one millionth follower. To celebrate, and to express thanks to our followers for joining us on all of our excursions, were collecting and sharing some of their favorite summer travel destinations.

title: Netflix Deletes 13 Reasons Why Suicide Scene
description: Netflix has deleted a graphic scene from the first season of 13 Reasons Why in which a teenage girl kills herself, more than two years after the episode premiered.

title: Scenes of Fire and Tear Gas During Protests in Puerto Rico
description: Protesters clashed with the police Monday night in San Juan, P.R. Demonstrators are calling for the resignation of Gov. Ricardo A. Rossell after pages of private messages leaked, showing the governor engaging in crude and inappropriate exchanges.

title: French Minister Who Dined on Lobster at Taxpayers Expense Resigns
description: VIERZON, France  The French environment minister, Franois de Rugy, under fire for lavish dinners on the public dime, resigned on Tuesday as discontent mounted in President Emmanuel Macrons political movement.

title: North Korea Hints at More Nuclear Tests Unless U.S. Ends Troop Drills With South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Only 16 days after President Trump set foot in North Korea to try to restart nuclear talks with its leader, North Korea on Tuesday escalated its pressure on the United States to cancel a planned joint military drill with South Korea, warning that it could scuttle efforts to resume dialogue with Washington and even prompt the North to resume nuclear and long-range missile tests.

title: One Italians Take on Classic Spaghetti al Pomodoro
description: In One Good Meal, we ask cooking-inclined creative people to share the story behind a favorite dish they actually make and eat at home on a regular basis  and not just when theyre trying to impress.

title: Boeing 737 Maxs Problems Force Ryanair to Cut Back Its Growth Plans
description: Ryanair, the Irish budget airline, said on Tuesday that it would scale back its growth plans for next summer because of expected delays in taking delivery of Boeing 737 Max planes.

title: A Runaway Train Explosion Killed 47, but Deadly Cargo Still Rides the Rails
description: When things go wrong, those in power often promise to make it right. But do they? In this series, The Times is going back to the scene of major news events to see if those promises were kept.

title: How Not to Smuggle Cocaine: Atop Your Head, Under a Hairpiece
description: Drug traffickers have resorted to many crafty, hard-to-detect methods of disguising what they are up to.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 3: On San Francisco Will Spend $600,000 to Erase History
description: Thank you to the 557 teenagers who participated in the third week of our 10-week Summer Reading Contest, and congratulations to Jaehyun Hong, our winner, as well as to our many runners-up and honorable mentions.

title: 5 Things We Learned From the 2020 Democratic Fund-Raising Reports
description: Mayor Pete Buttigieg soared and Senator Elizabeth Warren surged. Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. was solid. Senator Bernie Sanders held steady. Senator Kamala Harris scored late.

title: American Cooking and an Owners Eye
description: Belle Harlem has become a rare thing on the Manhattan scene, a mom-and-pop restaurant where the proprietors are always at home.

title: In Harlem, a Tiny Restaurant That Hums
description: The high cost of doing business in New York takes a toll on many restaurants in the long run, but it can also lead to compromises whose shortcomings become part of the fun  for diners, at least.

title: In Little Haiti, Barbecue Is Part of History
description: MIAMI  Haitian restaurants bloomed here in the 1990s and 2000s as their reputations grew for serving ambrosial rice and bean platters at cheap prices. On the weekends, barbecue smoke perfumed street corners and backyards as lines of customers formed.

title: The Sad Lesson From California
description: After more than a decade of contentious debate, New York has passed a law that entitles farmworkers to basic rights that most workers take for granted  the right to earn overtime, have a day off, collect unemployment insurance and join a union. The law corrects injustices that date back to the exclusion of farmworkers and domestics from the National Labor Relations Act, in an effort to win Southern votes by exempting the largely black work forces.

title: Coming Together in Mark Morriss V
description: #SpeakingInDance is a weekly visual exploration of dance on Instagram. Watch the video from our most recent post below, and follow us at @nytimes.

title: Facebook Cryptocurrency Plans Have a Problem: Facebooks Reputation
description: Lawmakers made it clear at a Senate Banking Committee hearing on Tuesday that they believe the biggest roadblock to Facebooks plan to enter the world of cryptocurrency and global finance is the companys reputation.

title: A Human Princess in The Sleeping Beauty
description: #SpeakingInDance is a weekly visual exploration of dance on Instagram. Watch the video from our most recent post below, and follow us at @nytimes.

title: House Condemns Trumps Attack on Four Congresswomen as Racist
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted on Tuesday to condemn as racist President Trumps attacks against four congresswomen of color, but only after the debate over the presidents language devolved into a bitterly partisan brawl that showcased deep rifts over race, ethnicity and political ideology in the age of Trump.

title: Go Broke or Go Home Bachelorette Parties
How We Reported on the Blackout in Manhattan
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: The Sweet Hallmark of an Indian Celebration
description: BLOOMFIELD, N.J.  All Hetal Vasavada wanted when she was growing up in suburban New Jersey was to have cake on her birthday. One with pink buttercream frosting, flowers piped on the top and her name written in fancy cursive.

title: Steve Cannon, Whose Townhouse Was an East Village Salon, Dies at 84
description: For years, Steve Cannon, a writer and publisher, maintained an open-door policy at his three-story Federal-style townhouse in the East Village of Manhattan, creating a salon that welcomed a revolving cast of visitors to join a continuing conversation.

title: Frenchette Chefs Will Run Le Veau dOr, a Veteran Bistro
description: Le Veau dOr, an Upper East Side bistro that has been a dining mainstay for more than 80 years, has new owners: the chefs behind one of Manhattans most in-demand restaurants.

title: Heres a Full List of the 2019 Emmy Nominations
description: Game of Thrones dominated the 2019 Emmy nominations, which were announced this morning. The Emmy awards ceremony will be held on Sept. 22 and will be broadcast on Fox from the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles.

title: Landlords Strike Back, Suing to Dismantle Rent Regulation System
description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

title: At War Review: French Factory Workers Fight Back
description: The great French actor Vincent Lindon has a special talent for embodying what could be a paradoxical persona: the outstanding Everyman. In At War, the fourth feature hes made with the director Stphane Briz, Lindon plays a workers leader at an auto plant facing closure.

title: How the Eric Garner Decision Compares With Other Cases
description: After the fatal chokehold of Eric Garner by a New York City police officer, a familiar pattern unfolded: Expressions of outrage, promises to investigate, a long wait for a resolution.

title: Irans Top Leader Strikes Defiant Tone as Trump Says Were Not Looking for Regime Change
description: Irans top leader struck a belligerent tone Tuesday in an escalating confrontation with the West, promising further Iranian violations of the fraying nuclear agreement and retaliation for what he called the piracy of an Iranian tanker by the vicious British.

title: Roger Stone Is Barred From Social Media After Posts Attacking Russia Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge on Tuesday ordered President Trumps former adviser Roger J. Stone Jr. off major social media platforms, declaring that he violated a gag order by using them to attack the special counsels investigation and officials tied to it.

title: Jerry Seltzer Dies at 87; Revived Roller Derby, Elbows and All
description: Jerry Seltzer, a second-generation showman who used television to revive enthusiasm for roller derby, the contact sport played on wheels that his father invented in the 1930s, died on July 1 at his home in Sonoma, Calif. He was 87.

title: Duterte, Infamous for His Sexist Jokes, Signs Law Against Sexual Harassment
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines, known for his long history of crude remarks about women, including jokes about rape, has signed a law that criminalizes wolf-whistling, catcalling and other forms of sexual harassment in public spaces.

title: After Tumultuous Protests, Puerto Rico Governor Insists He Will Not Resign
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Facing intense pressure to resign, Gov. Ricardo A. Rossell addressed Puerto Rico on Tuesday, the morning after tumultuous street protests shook the capital of San Juan, and refused to step down despite what he acknowledged was widespread public discontent.

title: Dine at Maxims Without Leaving New York City
description: No need to brave the crowds of tourists on the Rue Royale in Paris to visit Maxims. Starting Saturday, you can dine at a pop-up of the Belle poque restaurant on Eastern Parkway in Brooklyn. The installation  at the Norm, the Brooklyn Museums restaurant  accompanies the exhibit Pierre Cardin: Future Fashion, devoted to the designer, now 97, who has owned Maxims since 1981. The Norms walls will be covered with panels showing the Art Nouveau interior of Maxims, which opened in 1893 and attracted high society for decades. (There was a lavish replica of Maxims on Madison Avenue in Manhattan from 1985 to 2000.) At the Norm, the chef Saul Bolton, who runs the restaurant with Great Performances Hospitality Group, presents classics like salade Lyonnaise with bacon and poached egg; aioli with raw vegetables; steak frites; and profiteroles with chocolate sauce. Others dishes are modernized, like roast chicken with grilled peaches and chimichurri sauce. The menu includes both  la carte choices and a three-course prix fixe for $45. (Opens Saturday through Jan. 5)

title: Healthy Lifestyle May Reduce Dementia Risk
description: A healthy lifestyle might reduce the risk for dementia, even in people with a high genetic risk, new research suggests.

title: Ursula von der Leyen, First Woman Chosen for Top E.U. Job, Wins Confirmation
description: BRUSSELS  The first woman ever chosen to be the European Unions top executive clinched her selection on Tuesday, narrowly winning approval from the European Parliament after her unexpected nomination as a compromise candidate.

title: 16 Black Chefs Changing Food in America
description: Innovative and powerful, these leaders have finally crushed the notion that the food they cook must be rooted in the American South.

title: 5% of Congress Was Born Abroad. Those Members Show What It Means to Be American.
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump suggested foreign-born Americans should go back to the countries they were born in if they do not like it here, he may not have realized that his entreaty could have been addressed to 5 percent of Congress.

title: High Blood Pressure and High Cholesterol May Pose Special Risks in Young Adults
description: High blood pressure and high cholesterol in young adults may be particularly dangerous, new research suggests. It increases the risk for cardiovascular disease in later life, whatever risk factors develop in later years.

title: Europe Billed Galileo as Its Answer to GPS. Its Been Mostly Down for Days.
description: LONDON  When the European Union introduced its own satellite navigation program, it billed the service as more robust, precise and reliable than GPS  and a way to end the blocs reliance on the system controlled by the United States military.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: Up to $40/SQ. FT.

description: Waitress, the long-running Broadway show about a despondent waitress in a small-town diner who finds solace in making pies, will close on Jan. 5, 2020, producers announced on Tuesday.

description: The first man to hold the office of the presidency was famous for being unable to tell a lie. Even if it wasnt true, George Washingtons devotees believed that it was.

description: HBO's acclaimed political satire Veep may have come to an end after seven seasons this spring  but with an Emmy nomination for best comedy and a seventh acting nomination for Julia Louis-Dreyfus for her portrayal of Selina Meyer, the show still has plenty of reason to celebrate.

description: FAIRFAX, Va.  The National Rifle Associations largest donor is a magazine magnate, avid hunter and gun collector who died a dozen years ago.

description: MOSCOW  Russias Foreign Ministry has recently denied visas for teachers at a school in Moscow run by Western embassies, in what American officials suggested was an effort to exert political pressure on the United States by curtailing schooling for the children of diplomats.

title: Graeme McDowell Makes It Home, but Just Barely
description: If it came down to it, the guy from Portrush was prepared to take his quest to what he called the last chance saloon.

description: [Update: El Chapo was sentenced on Wednesday to life in a United States prison, ending one of historys most notorious criminal careers.]

title: Jharrel Jerome on His Emmy Nod and Why When They See Us Resonated
description: When They See Us, Ava DuVernays Netflix mini-series about the 1989 Central Park jogger case, is officially a strong Emmy contender after collecting 16 nominations on Tuesday. Among those accolades is a nod for outstanding lead actor in a limited series or movie for Jharrel Jerome, who plays Korey Wise, one of five teenagers who was accused of raping and assaulting a woman in Central Park.

title: He Turned the Met Museums Collection Into an Orchestra
description: Walking up the stairs of the Met Breuer last week, the British artist Oliver Beer pressed his face into a corner and began singing a slow succession of descending pitches. When he landed on a B flat, the walls suddenly vibrated with sympathetic resonance.

title: Tiny Love Stories: Will You Please Forgive Me?
description: Almost 50 years ago, Sue and I hurriedly married to avoid the embarrassment of being unwed parents in seven months. The ceremony remains a blur but the declaration of Until death do us part was unforgettable. Five years and two children later, we divorced. A few months ago, I was given the prognosis of one to two years of life. When I shared the news with Sue, she offered to care for me. Last month, we remarried. Our daughter was our witness as we declared once again: Until death do us part.  Rodney Santos

description: CHICAGO  Chance the Snapper, the elusive alligator that mesmerized a mostly alligator-free Midwestern city, has been caught.

title: What Weve Learned From Our Privacy Project (So Far)
description: The Privacy Project has been underway for four months, and in that time weve learned quite a bit about what we do  and dont  know about privacy.

title: Natasha Lyonne Is Thrilled For Russian Doll and the Emmys, We Think
description: If the premise of Russian Doll sounded familiar  a woman lives through the same night of her life, over and over and over again, to her frustration and eventual enlightenment  the actual show was anything but. This Netflix comedy series, which stars Natasha Lyonne as Nadia, the protagonist caught in an inexplicable time loop, and which she created with Leslye Headland and Amy Poehler, was a heartfelt and idiosyncratic tribute to the uncertainties of middle age, to the East Village and to Lyonnes own life, whose details are encrypted throughout the show.

title: Why Midsize Cities Struggle to Catch Up to Superstar Cities
description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C.  Within sight of a couple of huge brick smokestacks, looming witnesses to a past built on tobacco and powered by coal, there is something weirdly out of place about Wake Forest Universitys Institute for Regenerative Medicine.

title: Eugene Levy on His Emmy Nods and the Heart of Schitts Creek
description: It took a while, but Schitts Creek, a series about a wealthy family forced to move to a small rural town after losing their fortune, has finally landed Emmy recognition. The beloved Pop TV show received four nominations for its fifth and penultimate season Tuesday, including best lead actor in a comedy for Eugene Levy.

title: Mark Sanford, Once Targeted by Trump, Weighs Primary Challenge Against Him
description: Last summer, President Trump unleashed a last-minute Twitter attack that helped ensure the defeat of Representative Mark Sanford, a Republican from South Carolina who had dared to criticize him.

title: Donald Trump Wishes He Were Running Against Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

title: A Prosperous China Says Men Preferred, and Women Lose
description: TIANJIN, China  Bella Wang barely noticed the section on the application inquiring whether she was married or had children. Employers in China routinely ask women such questions, and she had encountered them before in job interviews.

title: Planned Parenthood Ousts President, Seeking a More Political Approach
description: Planned Parenthood on Tuesday removed its president after less than a year in the job, seeking new leadership at a time when abortion rights have come under increasing attack from statehouses and Republicans in Washington.

title: North Korea, China, Mumbai: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The North Korean leader has frequently been seen using expensive Mercedes-Benz and Rolls-Royce limousines, in open defiance of U.N. sanctions intended to keep his country from importing luxury goods.

title: Could Jack Have Fit? A Titanic Question for DiCaprio
description: As the frozen lovers Rose and Jack clung to a bobbing slab of timber in the icy Atlantic waters during the final moments of Titanic, audience members believed their love should have gone on.

description: ST. LOUIS  Bryan Garner was homeless and injecting as much fentanyl as he could get his hands on when he found the Missouri Network Outreach Center, a community center in an old brick rowhouse in St. Louis that connects people to addiction treatment.

description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has marked the anniversary of a failed coup against him every passing year  this week was the third  with a national holiday that has turned the traumatic event into a celebration of Turkish nationalism.

description: One of the largest disaster relief agencies on Tuesday had a message for the worlds mayors: Heat waves are getting more intense on a hotter planet, but they dont have to be deadly if city officials take simple and often inexpensive steps.

title: Trumps Policies, Not His Heckling, May Force Fed to Cut Rates
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump lacks official power to make the Federal Reserve cut interest rates, but he may have found a way to force its hand: stoking economic uncertainty.

title: Epsteins Ties to Former Israeli Leader Shake Up Election Campaign
description: JERUSALEM  A former Israeli leader who is seeking to topple Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is facing scrutiny over his financial and personal ties to Jeffrey Epstein, the American financier charged with sex trafficking and abusing underage girls.

description: Trump supporters and billionaire conservationists made for a strange mix Saturday night, at a 30th anniversary gala for the South Fork Natural History Museum in Bridgehampton, N.Y.

title: MS-13 Gang Members Charged With Brutal Murders in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  Using machetes, knives and baseball bats, members of the criminal MS-13 gang killed their victims, dismembered their bodies and threw their remains into a canyon in the Angeles National Forest, according to a sweeping indictment unsealed Tuesday by federal authorities in Los Angeles. In one instance, they said, members of the gang ripped out a victims heart.

title: No Questions About U.S. Wars in Defense Chiefs Confirmation Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps newest nominee to lead the Pentagon faced no questions from senators about the continuing wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, where thousands of American troops are deployed, during a mostly muted confirmation hearing on Tuesday.

description: A former Peruvian president wanted in connection with one of the biggest corruption scandals in Latin America was arrested in the United States on Tuesday, according to Peruvian and American officials.

title: E. Katherine Kerr, Actress and Playwright, Is Dead at 82
description: E. Katherine Kerr, a stage and screen actress and playwright who won strong reviews for her Off Broadway work and an Obie Award in 1982 for her performance in Caryl Churchills Cloud 9, died on July 1 in Sarasota, Fla. She was 82.

title: Johnny Clegg, South African Singer Who Battled Apartheid With Music, Is Dead at 66
description: Johnny Clegg, a British-born South African singer, songwriter and guitarist whose fusion of Western and African influences found an international audience and stood as an emblem of resistance to the apartheid authorities in his adopted land, died on Tuesday in Johannesburg. He was 66.

title: A Better Way to Manage Your Period? Try the Menstrual Cup, Scientists Say
description: Menstrual cups, little-known devices used by women to manage their periods, are safe and as effective as sanitary pads and tampons, as well as less expensive, according to the first comprehensive analysis of the products.

title: Read the House Resolution Condemning Trumps Racist Comments Directed at Members of Congress

title: Once Trump Talked About American Carnage. Now He Says Critics Should Leave.
description: WASHINGTON  America stinks. At least thats what Donald J. Trump seemed to be saying before becoming president.

title: A Day After It Was Filed, New Trump Asylum Policy Gets Hit in Court
description: LOS ANGELES  A coalition of immigrant advocacy groups on Tuesday sued the Trump administration in federal court, challenging a new rule intended to severely restrict the ability of people fleeing persecution to apply for asylum in the United States.

title: William Dannemeyer, 89, California Archconservative, Dies
description: William E. Dannemeyer, an immensely popular former California congressman whose long and implacable opposition to liberal causes cemented Orange Countys reputation as a citadel of conservatism in the 1980s, died on July 9 in Thousand Palms, Calif. He was 89.

title: Trumps Going to Get Re-elected, Isnt He?
description: Im struck at how many people have come up to me recently and said, Trumps going to get re-elected, isnt he? And in each case, when I drilled down to ask why, I bumped into the Democratic presidential debates in June. I think a lot of Americans were shocked by some of the things they heard there. I was.

title: Im an Engineer, and Im Not Buying Into Smart Cities
description: TORONTO  Like a classroom full of overachieving students, cities around the world are racing to declare themselves smart  using sensors, data and ubiquitous cameras to make themselves more efficient, safe and sustainable. Perhaps the most famous initiative is here in Toronto, where Sidewalk Labs, a sibling company to Google, recently released a 1,500-page master plan to remake two neighborhoods with things like snow-melting roads and an underground pneumatic-tube network.

title: In the Squad, Trump Finds His Foil
description: In picking a fight with the quartet of Democratic congresswomen known as the squad, President Trump has done more than divide the American public  again  on the question of whether hes a racist, a political opportunist or an occasionally overzealous patriot.

title: Tech Hearings: Congress Unites to Take Aim at Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers leveled stinging criticism and sharp questions at Big Tech executives on Tuesday, attacking Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google for their market power, their perceived bias as gatekeepers of communication and Facebooks ambitions to reshape the financial industry.

title: 6 Years Later, Citi Bike Comes to the Bronx. (What Took So Long?)

title: Judge Is Asked to Punish Officials Over Tactics in Census Question Dispute
description: WASHINGTON  Critics who sued to block the Trump administration from adding a citizenship question to the 2020 census asked a federal judge on Tuesday to punish administration officials, saying the officials had deliberately delayed the lawsuit in order to hide damning evidence  conduct they called nothing less than a fraud on the court.

title: Officer Pantaleo Should Be Fired for Eric Garners Death. A Judge Agrees.

title: A Girl, 15, Reported a Sexual Assault, Then the Detective Abused Her, Too
description: A Los Angeles County sex crimes investigator accused of raping a teenager after having been assigned to investigate her previous sexual assault allegations has pleaded guilty to lesser charges, and is expected to be sentenced to three years in prison.

title: Trump Sets the 2020 Tone: Like 2016, Only This Time the Squad Is Here
description: WASHINGTON  With three days of attacks on four liberal, minority first-term congresswomen, President Trump and the Republicans have sent the clearest signal yet that their approach to 2020 will be a racially divisive reprise of the strategy that helped Mr. Trump narrowly capture the White House in 2016.

title: John Paul Stevens: The Case That Drove Him to Retire
description: The former Supreme Court correspondent Linda Greenhouse recalls why the Citizens United case in 2010 led Justice John Paul Stevens to step down from the court.

title: Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens, Who Led Liberal Wing, Dies at 99
description: John Paul Stevens, whose 35 years on the United States Supreme Court transformed him, improbably, from a Republican antitrust lawyer into the outspoken leader of the courts liberal wing, died on Tuesday at a hospital in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 99.

title: To Help Smokers Quit, Pay Them
description: Paying people to stop smoking is a very effective method of getting them to quit, a large review of studies has found.

title: Iran Rejects Pompeos Suggestion It Is Willing to Negotiate Over Missile Program
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Tuesday that Iran appeared willing to negotiate over its missile program for the first time, in what he and President Trump presented as evidence that sanctions and military pressure were working, less than a month after the president halted a planned military strike against Iran.

title: In Addition
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  We have a really witty debut today from Adam Nicolle, one of those young guys who does a billion things with boundless energy. I find the differences between Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday themes to be a bit subtle at times, but I think this hits our midweek sweet spot  its a bit too heady for a Tuesday, and not quite arcane and abrasive enough for a Thursday. (Sorry, Thursday!)

title: The Republicans Who Voted to Condemn Trumps Remarks (and Other Things to Know)
description: WASHINGTON  The House, in a stunning rebuke of a sitting president, voted on Tuesday to strongly condemn President Trumps suggestion that four freshman Democratic women of color go home  a Twitter broadside described in a Democratic resolution as racist comments that have legitimized and increased fear and hatred of new Americans.

title: Elon Musks Neuralink Wants Sewing Machine-Like Robots to Wire Brains to the Internet
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Elon Musk aspires to make inserting a computer connection into your brain as safe and painless as Lasik eye surgery.

title: John Paul Stevens: Canny Strategist and the Finest Legal Mind Ford Could Find
description: WASHINGTON  Justice John Paul Stevens, who retired from the Supreme Court in 2010 and died on Tuesday at 99, was the last of a breed. He was chosen for his ability as a lawyer and not, as is common today, for how he was likely to vote in ideologically charged cases. In picking him in 1975, President Gerald R. Ford, a Republican, said all he wanted was the finest legal mind I could find.

title: Notre-Dame came far closer to collapsing than people knew. This is how it was saved.
description: A baffling alert. A race to the wrong building. Notre-Dame still stands only because firefighters decided to risk everything, a New York Times reconstruction has found.

title: John Paul Stevens Is Praised for Legal Prowess and Humble Approach
description: John Paul Stevens, one of the longest-serving justices ever to sit on the Supreme Court, died Tuesday at 99 after a stroke he had suffered the day before.

title: Hustlers Trailer: Cardi B Helps J. Lo and Constance Wu Get Revenge
description: These Wall Street guys, you see what they did to this country? They stole from everybody. Hard-working people lost everything. And thats not all. The game is rigged, and it does not reward people who play by the rules.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: Five years ago, Eric Garner was choked to death; today the federal government choked Lady Justice, and that is why we are outraged.

title: Corrections: July 17, 2019
description: NATIONAL

title: Mets Open Series With Victory Over Twins
description: Michael Conforto went 4-for-4, scored and drove in a run, and six Mets relievers combined for five shutout innings in a 3-2 victory over the host Minnesota Twins on Tuesday night.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Suits and Babylon
description: SUITS 9 p.m. on USA Network. This long-running legal drama begins its ninth and final season. Since the departure of Mike Ross (Patrick J. Adams), his wife, Rachel Zane (Meghan Markle), and the law firms head honcho, Jessica Pearson (Gina Torres) in Season 7, fans have watched the series mainstays, Harvey Specter (Gabriel Macht), Louis Litt (Rick Hoffman) and Donna Paulsen (Sarah Rafferty) vie for control of the firm. And while the Duchess of Sussex will in all likelihood not be back, fans can expect to see Adams return as a guest star in the shows final 10 episodes.

title: On Politics: House Condemns Trumps Attacks as Racist
description: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

title: What Kind of Peace Talks Are These?: On the Front Lines of a 17-Year War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The war in Afghanistan has raged for nearly 18 years, cost billions of dollars, shattered countless families and consumed the administrations of three American presidents. But it has taken a particularly heavy toll on Afghan troops and police officers, 45,000 of whom have been killed in the past five years of fighting alone.

title: Top Myanmar Generals Are Barred From Entering U.S. Over Rohingya Killings
description: BANGKOK  The United States has imposed sanctions on Myanmars top military commander, Senior Gen. Min Aung Hlaing, and three of his highest-ranking generals for their roles in the atrocities carried out against Rohingya Muslims since 2017, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced.

title: Trevor Noah Says Trumps Racism Might Not Be in His Bones
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: How Notre-Dame Was Saved: 5 Things We Know
description: How was it that fire ravaged Notre-Dame? And how was it saved?

title: Airbnb, Under Attack in New Jersey, Seeks a New Ally: Voters
description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

title: Pharrell Williams Discovers His Inner Child in a Gun-Filled Manga World
description: PARIS  Pharrell Williams has found a happy place for his inner child, and its a manga-style fantasy in which children have taken up arms. Thats the gist of A Call To Action, a new exhibition the American singer, producer and entrepreneur has curated for the Guimet Museum, a collection of Asian art here.

title: I Wanted to Know What White Men Thought About Their Privilege. So I Asked.
description: In the early days of the run-up to the 2016 election, I was just beginning to prepare a class on whiteness to teach at Yale University, where I had been newly hired. Over the years, I had come to realize that I often did not share historical knowledge with the persons to whom I was speaking. Whats redlining? someone would ask. George Washington freed his slaves? someone else would inquire. But as I listened to Donald Trumps inflammatory rhetoric during the campaign that spring, the class took on a new dimension. Would my students understand the long history that informed a comment like one Trump made when he announced his presidential candidacy? When Mexico sends its people, theyre not sending their best, he said. Theyre sending people that have lots of problems, and theyre bringing those problems with us. Theyre bringing drugs. Theyre bringing crime. Theyre rapists. When I heard those words, I wanted my students to track immigration laws in the United States. Would they connect the treatment of the undocumented with the treatment of Irish, Italian and Asian people over the centuries?

title: Why the V.A. Wont Pay for Service Dogs to Treat PTSD
description: On a sunny October day in 2017, Lara Trump, the presidents daughter-in-law, held a meeting in the West Wing to promote an initiative that would pair shelter dogs needing homes with veterans wanting to act on the increasingly widespread notion that well-trained dogs can improve the lives of people suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder and other mental-health conditions.

title: She Wasnt Exposed to Nuts. Why Was She Going Into Anaphylactic Shock?
description: Call 911, the 21-year-old woman gasped to her older sister. Im having an attack. The older sister looked over at the young woman. She looked scared, a thin layer of sweat glistening on her pale face. The older sister immediately picked up the phone and dialed. Shed heard about her sisters strange attacks but had never seen one. Her younger sister had come to her bedroom earlier that evening, saying that the inside of her mouth was itchy and that she was worried this was an allergic reaction. She didnt want to be alone, in case the two doses of Benadryl shed already taken werent enough.

title: How to Make an Ancient Grain Taste Better Than Mac and Cheese
description: For the first decade of my career, I took cooking incredibly seriously. As a restaurant cook, not to mention a nerd, I loved steeping myself in the history of a dish and all its traditions. I obsessed over pasta shapes, flour types and varieties of tomatoes and their specific, appropriate uses. I wanted my food to echo hundreds, or even thousands, of years of tradition  or at the very least to be something a nonna would recognize and enjoy.

title: Born to Walk Barefoot
description: Wearing shoes when we walk changes how our feet interact with the ground below us, according to a novel new study in the journal Nature of shod and unshod walkers, the state of their feet and the extent of the forces they generate with every step.

title: Reinventing Hotel Guest Books for Modern Times
description: In early January, a guest stayed in room 812 at the Hotel Alex Johnson, in Rapid City, S.D. As the anonymous visitor wrote in the guest book the next morning, the night was a bit more than uneventful.

title: Bob Dylan and the Myth of Boomer Idealism
description: In his Netflix film Rolling Thunder Revue, which chronicles Bob Dylans face-paint-streaked 1975 tour of the same name, Martin Scorsese introduces us to a former congressman from Michigan named Jack Tanner. Tanner sits at a farmhouse table in a spacious home, wearing a tweed jacket and no tie, hair gray and a little shaggy, a patrician Everyboomer who could have walked out of a financial-planning ad. In November of 75, he says, he was on the way home from a meeting with Jimmy Carter when a storm grounded his plane in Niagara Falls, N.Y. He called Carter from the motel. He says, Well, you just hit the jackpot, Tanner recalls. Bob Dylan is doing this Rolling Thunder concert there tonight, and you can go.

title: It May Not Seem That Way, but Politicians Often Do What Voters Want
description: Do politicians care what voters want? New evidence may suggest they dont  and many voters are skeptical, too. A 2018 survey by the Pew Research Center reports that less than half the country says elected officials care what ordinary people think.

title: At a Missouri Jail, Bras Set Off the Metal Detector (and a Heated Debate)
description: The metal detector at the Jackson County Detention Center in Kansas City, Mo., beeped repeatedly when Laurie Snell, a lawyer, tried to enter the facility on May 31.

title: With Name-Calling and Twitter Battles, House Republican Campaign Arm Copies Trumps Playbook
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the House Intelligence Committee is portrayed as wearing clown makeup. Democratic congressional candidates  including an Air Force combat veteran  are labeled socialist losers or anti-Semites. Others have been singled out as Lyin Lucy McBath, Fake Nurse Lauren Underwood, Little Max Rose and China Dan McCready.

title: The Kids Are Not All Right
description: THE WHISPER MANBy Alex North355 pp. Celadon Books. $26.99.

title: Google Glass May Have an Afterlife as a Device to Teach Autistic Children
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Esae Prickett sat down in the living room with his mother, father and four older brothers, he was the only one wearing Google Glass.

title: Orange Is the New Black Taught Us What Netflix Was For
description: Orange Is the New Black, finishing its seven-season run on July 26, was big. Big in its reach (presumably, though actual viewing figures for Netflix series are still an occult mystery). Big in its influence, as one of the first genuinely original programs in the new medium of streaming. Big in its ambitions to represent faces and situations that had been left off TV screens.

Having traveled nearly 8,500 miles across Asia and Europe, only 177 more divided the 87-year-old Australian from victory.

title: Essex, Conn.: A Small Town Where History Lives On
description: Before moving into their Federal-era home in the river town of Essex, Conn., Pam and Tom Carroll demolished an addition in back and gutted the interior. The three-bedroom house, for which they paid $500,000, fronts Main Street in Essex Village and has backyard views of a cove off the Connecticut River. But it was in sorry shape when they bought it, said Ms. Carroll, 57, an interior designer.

The country was going to be like the state of Medina that the Prophet Muhammad founded  a welfare state  Khan promised. Less than a year after coming to power, he has delivered a new Pakistan, and it looks like a struggling dictatorship.

title: Military and Civilian Leaders in Sudan Inch Forward With Political Deal

But key details of the deal, including the powers of a transitional ruling council and cabinet, have yet to be agreed on.

title: Nate Lashley Finally Breaks Out After Playing Golf Through Tragedy

Lashley paused to greet an octogenarian friend who was following his first round at the John Deere Classic last Thursday, and said, I should have taken this week off.

title: Amazon Faces E.U. Inquiry Over Data From Independent Sellers

For the bigger picture, though, when he needed personal and professional mentoring, German turned to an unusual source  a once-promising pitcher who struggled immensely in his own major league career.

title: Louvre Removes Sackler Family Name From Its Walls

Another was a Taiwanese businessman who was secretly helping North Korea buy precision tools for its nuclear weapons program. Yet another was a corrupt Ukrainian politician spiriting millions of embezzled dollars out of his country.

description: Toward the end of the 1994 blockbuster The Lion King, Simba, deep in the throes of an existential crisis, is reunited with the spirit of his dead father, Mufasa, who appears as an apparition in the starry night sky. You have forgotten me, Mufasa tells his son, before urging Simba to assume his rightful place on the throne of Pride Rock.

title: A Fantastic Summer Salad

Someone left a lot of zucchini on my counter when I wasnt looking, and when it came time for dinner I thought to make Colu Henrys lemony pasta with zucchini and fresh herbs (above). But it was hot enough in the kitchen already that I didnt want to boil water for the pasta, so I went off the books and made a kind of no-recipe zucchini slaw instead, and served it with a loaf of Italian bread and some scallops quickly sauted in butter.

This was the MacBook Air that The Guardian used to store files leaked by the United States intelligence contractor Edward Snowden. Guardian employees destroyed the computer with power tools in July 2013 after the files on it were deemed a threat to British national security.

title: John Paul Stevens Dissented Until the End

The court is the most opaque institution in American government, and its members go to great lengths to keep it that way. They avoid weighing in publicly on live legal questions, and they rarely, if ever, criticize the work of the courts current members.

title: We Need People Like Justice Stevens More Than Ever
description: As I looked back on Justice John Paul Stevenss life and career, I did not immediately think of his many majority opinions for the Supreme Court  opinions establishing the law of our land on matters of war in the era of global terrorism, limits to the death penalty and more. I didnt even think of the exceptional dissents from his closing years on the court in cases addressing campaign finance laws and gun restrictions. Instead, it was two of his dissenting opinions from the 1980s that first came into my mind when I learned that he died on Tuesday at 99 years old, and they havent left it in the time since.

title: Lucette Lagnado, Memoirist of Jews in Old Cairo, Dies at 62

title: Apollo 11 Anniversary: Everything You Need to Read on the Moon Landing

Four days later, Mr. Armstrong and Mr. Aldrin set foot on the moons surface, the first of 12 American astronauts to complete this feat. Apollo 11 fascinated the world, with hundreds of millions tuning in to watch it on TV. It also changed the way we understood our solar system.

title: An Eccentric Upstate Home That Some People Confuse for a Restaurant

The fact that it also provided a second home for the enormous trove of antiques and art objects that already filled their main residence in N.Y.C. was an added bonus.

title: Mexico Is Doing Trumps Dirty Work. Enough.
description: MEXICO CITY  Donald Trump is the most aggressive American president Mexico has had to contend with since James K. Polk, who in 1846 sought a declaration of war against my country. Though Mr. Trump has not declared war against Mexico outright, he has threatened us with tariffs, insulted us, and ordered brutal raids that have sowed fear and anxiety in millions of Mexican immigrants living in the United States, even those there legally.

title: Bright Lights? Dimmer. Big City? More Distant.

title: David Crosby: Remember My Name Review: Highs, Lows and Hanging On
description: The new documentary David Crosby: Remember My Name finds its subject in fine voice. A graying walrus of a man who favors knitted skullcaps and blue jeans held up with suspenders, he is a prodigious talker and still a terrific singer, having lost remarkably little of his vocal range after more than a half century of not always taking the best care of himself. The anxiety latent in the title of the film, directed by A.J. Eaton, seems misplaced. Crosbys name is affixed to two supergroups  one with Neil Young, one without  whose close harmonies and open-chord, acoustic-guitar-driven sound are fixtures of many a parental and grandparental playlist. Teach your children well!

title: The Problems With Risk Assessment Tools
description: We cant end mass incarceration without first changing what happens before trial. On any given day, the United States incarcerates nearly half a million people who have only been accused of a crime and await their day in court.

I can love and admire your work, but you cannot love and admire my work.

title: U.S. Punishes Turkey by Canceling Sale of Jets
description: WASHINGTON  The White House informed Turkey, a NATO ally, on Wednesday that the United States would not sell it F-35 stealth fighter jets, in retaliation for the countrys purchase of Russian S-400 surface-to-air missile systems.

title: 5 Million Bulgarians Have Their Personal Data Stolen in Hack
description: An investigation into the theft of the personal information of nearly every adult in Bulgaria led to the arrest of a 20-year-old computer programmer, the police announced Wednesday, in connection with a breach that underscores the vulnerability of vast troves of digitized information.

title: The Boeing 737 Max Crisis Is a Leadership Failure
description: Weve seen this before: A Boeing airliner crashes, killing all aboard. Investigators believe a design flaw in the aircraft played a major role in the accident, but Boeing blames the pilots. Eventually, the design flaw is corrected, but not before another plane crashes, leaving more deaths in its wake.

title: John Paul Stevens Was Justice Incarnate
description: My solace on hearing the news of John Paul Stevenss death is that he went quickly. I saw him for the last time two months ago, at a reunion he held for his law clerks near his home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. Physically, he appeared as well as anyone could expect of someone who had just turned 99. His mind was as sharp as it was when I finished my clerkship with him 12 years ago. He suffered a stroke on Monday and on Tuesday he was gone.

title: Pilot Whales in Georgia Are Saved From Being Beached
description: The camera panned to the waters edge on St. Simons Islands East Beach in Georgia, where a row of short-finned pilot whales writhed, clicked and whistled as their shiny black bodies caught breaking waves in the late afternoon light on Tuesday.

title: Facebook and Google Trackers Are Showing Up on Porn Sites
description: Silicon Valleys biggest companies are always watching you  even when youre browsing pornography websites in incognito mode.

title: Beautiful to Close at the End of October
description: Beautiful, the Tony and Grammy Award-winning jukebox musical about the life and songs of Carole King, will close on Oct. 27, 2019, producers announced on Wednesday, after nearly six years on Broadway.

title: What Trump Is Teaching Our Children
description: When our children are young, we work doggedly to foster in them a deep and abiding sense of morality, ethics and character.

title: Why Leana Wen Quickly Lost Support at Planned Parenthood
description: WASHINGTON  Leana Wen had already made a name for herself as Baltimores health commissioner when Planned Parenthood hired her as its new president last fall.

title: Ex-L.S.U. Student Convicted in Fraternity Hazing Death of Freshman
description: A former student at Louisiana State University was convicted Wednesday of negligent homicide for his role in the hazing death of an 18-year-old fraternity pledge who became extremely intoxicated during an initiation ritual in 2017.

title: Mets Bullpen Shows Signs of Life in 2-Game Sweep of the Twins
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The Mets bullpen accomplished something the last two days at Target Field that seemed unlikely as recently as last week.

title: Pumpsie Green, First Black Player for Boston Red Sox, Dies at 85
description: On July 21, 1959, Pumpsie Green made his major league debut as an eighth-inning pinch-runner with the Boston Red Sox, then played shortstop to finish the game against the Chicago White Sox at Comiskey Park.

title: Bit of Kindling
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Gosh, and just yesterday I was calling the Thursday puzzle abrasive. Todays grid, by Matthew Sewell, is lively and bright from top to bottom and seemed like a much quicker solve than it was. I started with the CASTRO brother, which helped pop COAT into my mind at 1A, and that was enough to elevate my mood for the whole day, not just the time it took to plow through this puzzle. Its the Kramer association more than anything.

title: Review: A Mexican Medea Heads to New York in Mojada
description: The woman who dreams of flying has made a prison of her life. Portrayed with an impassive mien and a wounded gaze by Sabina Ziga Varela, the heroine of Luis Alfaros spirited, mournful Mojada is first seen holding two outsize tropical leaves as if they were wings, like a bird about to take off.

title: Quotation of the Day: Impeachment Bid Fizzles, Showing Democratic Split
description: We all ought to go on record. We all ought to let the world know where we stand when we have a bigot in the White House.

title: How Not to Insult Donald Trump
description: Maybe we should stop talking about Donald Trump being a racist. He seems to love the idea too much.

title: Corrections: July 18, 2019
description: FRONT PAGE

title: At Rally, President Accuses Liberal Critics of Seeking the Nations Destruction
description: GREENVILLE, N.C.  President Trump road-tested his attacks on four Democratic congresswomen on Wednesday, casting them as avatars of anti-American radicalism and reiterating his call for them to leave the country, as a raucous crowd chanted, Send her back! Send her back!

title: The App That Tucks Me In at Night
description: Every night, a strangers voice in my phone soothes me to sleep. I wanted to hear her in person.

title: Hawaiian Elders Protesting Telescope Construction Are Arrested
description: Construction was set to begin this week on a giant telescope on the barren summit of Mauna Kea, a volcano on Hawaiis Big Island, considered the best observatory site in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Theresa May, Bulgaria, Latvia: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Suspected Arson at Kyoto Animation Studio Kills 33, Shocking Japan
description: TOKYO  The attacker was heard screaming Die! as he ignited the liquid he had splashed around an anime studio in Japan.

title: Have We Hit Peak Podcast?
description: In 2016, Morgan Mandriota and Lester Lee, two freelance writers looking to grow their personal brands, decided to start a podcast. They called it The Advice Podcast and put about as much energy into the shows production as they did the name. (After all, no one was paying them for this. Yet.) Each week, the friends, neither of whom had professional experience dispensing advice, met in a free room at the local library and recorded themselves chatting with an iPhone 5.

title: Seeking Soccer Talent, Club Executives Turn to Speed Dating
description: LONDON  It had all the hallmarks of an afternoon of speed dating. Strangers hoping to find that right match.

title: U.S. to Send About 500 More Troops to Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is sending hundreds of troops to Saudi Arabia in what is intended as the latest show of force toward Iran, two Defense Department officials said Wednesday.

title: For Northern Ireland, This British Open Is More Than a Golf Tournament
description: PORTRUSH, Northern Ireland  Rory McIlroy will assuredly receive the loudest ovations throughout the British Open. McIlroy, a native of Northern Ireland and the third-ranked golfer in the world, has already drawn hordes of spectators to his practice rounds at Royal Portrush Golf Club, the tournament site and a course he has played since he was 10.

title: Whats the Future of Syrian Refugees in Turkey?
description: ISTANBUL  Walid Zeidan, a 37-year-old Syrian man, works as a cook in the bustling Malta Bazaar in the Fatih district adjacent to the Golden Horn in Istanbul. Mr. Zeidan, who ran a restaurant in the Eastern Ghouta suburb of Damascus, lost his home and business in a bombing by the forces of the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad. After surviving the August 2013 sarin gas attack on Eastern Ghouta, which killed hundreds, he sought refuge in Turkey.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: The Real Housewives of New York City and Secret Obsession
description: THE REAL HOUSEWIVES OF NEW YORK CITY 9 p.m. on Bravo. After 11 seasons of Bravos long-running reality franchise, you may have thought they would have run out of drama. But you would be wrong. This season has seen fan-favorites like Luann The Countess de Lesseps, Bethenny Frankel and Sonja Morgan bicker with one another and their newer counterparts, yelling about etiquette, money, lobsters and of course, the fashion label Jovani. In the second night of the reunion special, all six cast members sit down with Andy Cohen to discuss all the shade that was thrown this season, including rumors about Tinsley Mortimers financial situation, Dorinda Medleys infamous Fish Room and Lessepss singing ability.

title: Puerto Ricos Political Protests Explained in 3 Numbers
description: Protesters have been filling the streets of San Juan, Puerto Rico, calling for Gov. Ricardo A. Rossell to resign. Here are the reasons fueling their anger.

title: Puerto Ricans in Protests Say Theyve Had Enough
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  In the crushing days after Hurricane Maria, Gov. Ricardo A. Rossell declared in no uncertain terms, Puerto Rico se levanta. Puerto Rico rises.

title: On Politics: House Kills Impeachment Resolution
description: Good Thursday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

title: Go-Home Gate Roils Late Night (and Congress, Too)
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Showing Respect for Americanisms
description: James writes: My husband ignores me when I refer to our couch as a couch. We live in England, where it is known as a sofa. Whilst it is unusual to say couch here, I have done so for decades without confusion. Lately he has responded to me by acting confused and claiming we dont own a couch.

title: A Look Inside the Secretive World of Guantnamo Bay
description: Take a tour of the base and its military prison, which has been housing detainees for more than 17 years.

title: Where Roe v. Wade Has the Biggest Effect
description: In a post-Roe world, abortions would fall significantly, and access would become highly uneven.

title: Pete Buttigieg Is Still Figuring This Out
description: It was a humid Sunday in June, a quiet afternoon that Pete Buttigieg knew would not remain quiet. You know, there are always going to be ups and downs, the 37-year-old mayor of South Bend, Ind., told me as he puttered through the kitchen of the century-old Victorian home he shares with his husband of a year, Chasten. You cant just have an uninterrupted meteoric rise, he said.

title: Poem: Midway
description: At first, the ghost prompting this anthem to middle age appears as both an ancestral spirit and the specter of mortality. Chaun Ballard builds his bluesy genealogy with metonymy and synecdoche, from squeaking shoes and Polaroids to neckties and healthy diets. Even though our speaker has joined the ranks of adults, he continues to appreciate the bounty that has shaped his cultural inheritance. In the end, this gently ironic self-assessment not only pays tribute to the luck that has propelled him through life but also eulogizes a loved one less fortunate  that ghost from his youth. Selected by Rita Dove

title: Roller Coasters 2019: What to Ride
description: Another summer, another dive, launch, twirl and loop.

title: Arthritis Is Tied to Heart Disease Risk
description: Having osteoarthritis may increase the risk of death from cardiovascular disease.

title: Feeling Lonely? Perhaps Youd Like to Talk to Some Strangers
description: When Ankit Shah graduated from college and moved to the Bay Area in 2013, he didnt know a single person there. Hungry for connections, he asked his Facebook friends to ask their Bay Area-based friends if theyd like to have tea with him, a stranger.

title: Will Trumps Racism Sink the G.O.P.?
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:

title: How an Impenetrable M.T.A. Overhaul Could Actually Affect Your Subway Ride
description: Everyone agrees that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority needs to be fixed. Not everyone agrees on how to do it.

title: The Challenge of Reporting on Women in China, Where Men Control the Narrative
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: As Washington Seeks Budget Deal, Negotiators Try to Sideline Mulvaney
description: WASHINGTON  As the federal government inches closer toward a potentially disastrous default on its debts, lawmakers and some Trump administration officials desperate for a budget deal have carefully maneuvered negotiations away from the man who has emerged as the common enemy: Mick Mulvaney, the acting White House chief of staff.

title: You Make the Call: Finding the Right Brooklyn Pad in One Weekend
description: A recent graduate makes a critical decision on the fly. Which apartment did he choose?

title: Mt. Vernon Has 2 Mayors, and Its Police Commissioner Was Just Arrested
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y.  On one side of City Hall, Richard Thomas, the former and possibly still-current mayor of Mount Vernon was in his office on Tuesday, the door guarded by two police officers.

title: Mellody Hobson of Ariel Investments: Capitalism Needs to Work for Everyone
description: Mellody Hobson was raised by a single mother and endured economic hardship as a child. The phone was shut off. The car was repossessed. Her family was evicted.

title: Trumps Immigration Approach Isnt New: Europe and Australia Went First
description: President Trumps approach to migration, which has reshaped American border enforcement with its zero tolerance policy, follows a model pioneered by the European Union and Australia  though they may not have pursued it with Mr. Trumps bombast.

title: A Playlist to Deter the Homeless: Baby Shark and Raining Tacos
description: Parry Gripp acknowledges that his 2012 hit, Raining Tacos, can be obnoxious. He wrote the song with a specific audience in mind: children and people who like tacos a lot.

title: These Are the Mistakes Democrats Dont Want to Repeat in 2020
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats still dont agree on why they lost the White House in 2016. But they have absolutely no intention of repeating their mistakes.

title: I Can See You Are Gay; I Will Kill You
description: Last month, Botswanas High Court unanimously struck down key sections of the countrys penal code that punished homosexuality with up to seven years in prison. Human dignity is harmed when minority groups are marginalized, Judge Michael Leburu, one of the three ruling judges in the panel, concluded. Human rights activists are celebrating the move as a victory.

title: 36 Hours in Atlantic City
description: Atlantic Citys boom-and-bust cycle has been in motion for decades now, with new casinos and restaurants sowing high hopes for revitalization, followed by mass closings, and then the whole thing happening on repeat. The key to enjoying this seaside New Jersey city, where the beach is often a secondary consideration, is to revisit old favorites interspersed with whichever new places have opened their doors, whether thats the newly legal sports books in the casinos or hip beer gardens. The longtime pleasures of Atlantic City  the gambling, the funnel cake and the amusements  never change and should be enjoyed to the fullest. And, if you can squeeze in a whiskey from an innovative local distillery, an oyster happy hour and a stimulating museum on African-American history at the same time, consider it a bonus.

title: Crystal Cathedral in California Gets a New Life as a Catholic Church
description: A prominent house of worship in Southern California has been flipped  from a towering glass megachurch of a flamboyant televangelist to the new seat of the seventh-largest Roman Catholic Church diocese in the United States.

title: The Story of 8 Unforgettable Words About Apollo 11
description: [Read all Times reporting on the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing. | Sign up for the weekly Science Times email.]
